title: Async cache api
body: To converse with an async backend

title: set('views') does not work anymore
body:
Renaming the views folder in the example to "viewsa" and then doing 
      set('views', __dirname + '/viewsa')
in configure() does not work anymore. It will be overwritten by the default from the view plugin later on.

Is this because of the change from js-oo to Class?

title: Ext problem with keys
body:
Looks like Ext is setting "keys" on every object. This means no one can set keys on anything anymore. This is a problem with libraries such as redisclient (http://github.com/fictorial/redis-node-client/) which uses "keys". Here a little example that will blow up. 

require('express')

var foo = {
  keys:1
}

title: delete flash() vals onResponse instead of at call time
body:
```
flash('info', 'snow storm coming')
flash('info') => ['snow storm coming']
flash('info') => ['snow storm coming']
--- next request ----
flash('info') => null
```

title: Https urls are not supported in the http client
body:
Let's have a look here : http://groups.google.com/group/nodejs/browse_thread/thread/616e6e9465b1c9c1

The test case is only : require("http").get("https://...")

title: HTTP client refactor
body: send body '' default unless GET remove allowData / defaulting

title: get('http://...', {}, { data }) should convert data hash to query string
body:
append when present, remove allowData, but default
all others to {}, or default all to {} if queryString.stringify() cooperates 
with an empty hash

title: HTTP client redirect option
body: default to 3 redirects

title: Flash returns undefined instead of empty string
body:
`this.flash("idontExist")` returns undefined instead of an empty string. Fixed here in my view-helper branch:
http://github.com/aheckmann/express/commit/e0eaa9371b5ad4418ea33175a31ded93cdb4242f

title: Namespaced caching
body:
accept any number of params so for example:
    cache.set('view', path)

which is cleaner than
   cache.set('view' + path)

we need this so that view caches do not collide
with future path caches

title: Multipart data posted are not working with nodejs 0.1.28
body:
The multipart module has been rewrite http://github.com/ry/node/commit/3adcdfc2e1db7ce0adb017a92864d44424e99012

For example, steams are now emitting "partBegin" and "partEnd".
And parts are not emitting events anymmore.

The documentation seems up to date.

body:
better suited for wrapping in lists. Also flash() with no args should
check presence of ANY flash messages, so that the user may
work with this in a view

partly to get rid of all the 'part' cruft currently being passed, but it would

title: Fix upload issue if a part completes before all parts have started buffering
body:
we use ++pendingFiles internally to determine how many
files are waiting, however its possible that the first (or another) part
could emitSuccess() before one or more remaining parts have even started,
hence will never increment pendingFiles

title: Fix multipart posts when files are not present
body: hangs

title: use(Session) should auto enable Cookie
body:
Just starting out with your new Session feature. Noticed that if use(Cookie) is not set the app crashes.

```
TypeError: Object #<an IncomingMessage> has no method 'cookie'
    at [object Object].<anonymous> (/Library/NodeServer/sites/proton/express/lib/express/plugins/session.js:191:33)
    at [object Object].trigger (/Library/NodeServer/sites/proton/express/lib/express/plugin.js:53:29)
    at /Library/NodeServer/sites/proton/express/lib/express/request.js:216:14
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at [object Object].each (/Library/NodeServer/sites/proton/express/lib/express/collection.js:84:18)
    at IncomingMessage.trigger (/Library/NodeServer/sites/proton/express/lib/express/request.js:215:18)
    at [object Object].route (/Library/NodeServer/sites/proton/express/lib/express/core.js:282:13)
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (/Library/NodeServer/sites/proton/express/lib/express/core.js:266:55)
    at ServerSideConnection.<anonymous> (/usr/local/lib/node/libraries/http.js:340:14)
    at node.js:990:9
```

title: uploaded files not always available when route executes
body:
Uploaded files are written into /tmp but are not necessarily ready for manipulation when the stream is complete and `self.route` executes in core.js.

Not sure how we should handle this. Everything should be async yes, but this leads to some nasty coding in the route handler. I'm currently needing to continue to test whether or not each tmp file exists before continuing. To me this seems like something that should be handled within Express - ie, not run the route until the files are all finished being written to /tmp.

title: file uploads fail when `part` events fire too quickly
body: Uploads intermittently fail if the streams path event fires too quickly. This is caused by the timestamping done to make the temp filename unique.

title: Fix node's Error-like object printing, or use Error only
body: currently produces useless stack-traces since the messages dont get outputted correctly

title: calling respond from callback crashes
body:
this little app crashes the whole process for me (not just a traceback in a status 500 page):
http://gist.github.com/289409

Traceback looks like this:

```
[object Object].emitSuccess (node.js:283:15)
[object Object].<anonymous> (node.js:695:21)
[object Object].emitSuccess (node.js:283:15)
node.js:552:29
node.js:1027:1
node.js:1031:1
```

title: locals are not available to layouts
Simplify file upload access
body: It would be nice if `this.params.post` had a `files` array containing all of the uploaded file objects. This would make it much easier to handle situations in which an unknown number of files are uploaded.

title: Use a promise with Static file
body: Then we can halt() within sendfile()

title: static.send throws on non-existent files
body:
In places where `request.halt()` is called in `static.send()` execution continues so that when a non-existent file is sent an error is thrown.

```
Error: Unhandled emitError: [{"message":"No such file or directory","stack":"Error: No such file or directory\n    at node.js:1025:9\n    at node.js:1029:1","errno":2}]
    at node.js:297:17
    at IdleWatcher.callback (node.js:387:5)
    at node.js:1025:9
    at node.js:1029:1
```

I fixed this and sent a pull request. 
http://github.com/aheckmann/express/commit/ae8f9e1137f7b444e5a137db73b5a514388858a4

title: Flip view extensions
body:
so instead of:
    layout.haml.html

it should be
    layout.html.haml

so that IDEs can provide syntax highlighting correctly.

title: Allow views to omit type extension
body:
so instead of
    layout.html.haml

we could have
    layout.haml

which would require us to add haml and sass to the mime type table,
however ejs and other more generic template engines would need to have
this type extension or use contentType()

title: Can't render templates with .haml extension
body: Templates need a .haml.html extension, which throws off syntax highlighting and just seems really lame.
